redcap:ProjectDashboards.title: Survey dissemination instructions for F3 (Co-Participant)
redcap:ProjectDashboards.body:
If you wish to customize the text that displays on the survey completion (after the 'submit' button is clicked):

    • Go to Designer (via the left-hand navigation bar in the Project Home and Design section)
    • Click on Survey Settings for the Form F3 Covid Impact Survey - Co-Participant instrument
    • Scroll down to the Survey Termination Options section
    • Enter your text into the 'Survey Completion Text' box
    • Scroll down and click on the 'save changes' button
To disseminate this survey in-person
In preparation for dissemination:
  • Bookmark the public survey link on the device that the Co-participant will be completing the survey
    • To access the public survey link, on the tablet:
      • open the browser and log into your institutions' REDCap site
      • click on the project that contains the survey
      • click on Survey Distribution Tools (found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section)
      • click the 'open public survey' button. This will open a new tab with the survey. Use browser tools to bookmark the page (consider adding it as a button to the home screen) 
  • Bookmark the Record Status Dashboard page of the project
    • To access the record status dashboard, on the tablet:
      • open the browser and log into your institutions' REDCap site
      • click on the project that contains the survey
      • click on Record Status Dashboard (found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section)
      • Use browser tools to bookmark the page (consider adding it as a button to the home screen) 
        • Note: when a person clicks on this bookmark, they will be prompted to log into REDCap.
When the Co-participant is with you:
  1. Click on the public survey link (the one that you bookmarked on the tablet)
  2. Enter the participant ID, ADRC number and your initials
  3. After you click submit, the Co-participant survey is loaded onto the screen. Hand the device to the Co-participant.
If the Co-participant needs to return to the survey

If the Co-participant accidentally closes the browser tab or for some other reason starts but does not complete the survey and needs to return to it, you will need to log into REDCap, retrieve their specific survey and give them access to it. To do that:

1. Click on your bookmarked Record Status Dashboard page

2. Find the Co-participant's record in that list.

3. Click on the circle that aligns with the survey.

4. Click on 'Survey Options'

5. Select 'open survey & Log out'. This is important because it prevents the Co-participant from accessing the project and seeing other people's responses. 

6. Hand the tablet to the Co-participant.

If you have questions, please click on the 'Contact REDCap administrator' button found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Help & Information section.

To disseminate this survey via email

1. Log into your institution's REDCap site.

2. Click on the project that contains the survey.

3. Click on 'Add/Edit Records' (via the left-hand navigation bar in the Data Collection section).

4. Click on the circle that aligns with Participant and Site Information.

5. Enter the participant ID, your site name and your initials. 

6. Click on 'save & go to next form'

    -you may have to click on the drop-down arrow on the 'save' button to see the option for 'save & go to next form'

7. Click the 'Survey Options' button and select 'compose survey invitation'

8. Select the address from which you wish to send the survey

9. Enter the Co-participant's email address

10. Enter a subject line

11. Add any custom text that you'd like to the message section of the invitation. HOWEVER: do not delete [ survey-link ] or [ survey-url ]. Those are smart variables which will turn into a unique survey link for the Co-participant once you hit send.

12. Click 'send'

If you have questions, please click on the 'Contact REDCap administrator' button found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Help & Information section.

redcap:ProjectDashboards.title: An overview of this project (F3 - Co-Participant)
redcap:ProjectDashboards.body:
Instruments

There are 2 data collection instruments in this project:

1. Participant and Site Information

2. The Co-participant survey

The Participant and Site Information instrument is completed by the Examiner. The instrument captures the center name, participant ID and examiner initials. Behind the scenes, REDCap will capture the date/time that the examiner fills out that instrument. 

The Co-participant survey is filled out by the Co-participant. Included in the survey are timestamp fields which will calculate, behind-the-scenes, how long it takes the Co-participant to complete the survey. 

Records

Each record represents a Co-participant. For your convenience, the participant ID has been added as a custom record label. This means that when viewing records, the participant's ID number will be written next to the record number. When using 'Add/Edit' records, records will display in order of the participant ID. (The participant ID is related to the participant, not the Co-Participant).

Survey Duration report

There is a built-in report that captures the survey duration. You will find that on the left-hand navigation bar in the Reports section. The report is called 'Survey duration (in minutes)'. 

Survey responses report

There is a built-in report that captures all of the participant responses, regardless of if they completed the survey. You will find that on the left-hand navigation bar in the Reports section. It is called 'Survey responses'. You can click on the live filter at the top of the report to limit it to just completed responses. 

Needs not addressed report

There is a built-in report that lists the details provided by the Co-Participant if they indicated that they have needs that have not been addressed. You will find that on the left-hand navigation bar in the Reports section. The report is called 'Needs not addressed'. 

Adding users to the project

Anyone on staff who will need access to the project (to email survey invitations, retrieve partially-completed survey responses, view responses, view calculations, etc) should be added as a user to the project. If you are unfamiliar with how to add users to the project, please contact your REDCap administrator. You can do that by clicking on the blue 'Contact REDCap administrator' button found on the left-hand navigation bar in the Help & Information section.

If you wish to customize the text that displays on the survey completion (after the 'submit' button is clicked):
    • Go to Designer (via the left-hand navigation bar in the Project Home and Design section)
    • Click on Survey Settings for the Form F3 Covid Impact Survey - Co-Participant instrument
    • Scroll down to the Survey Termination Options section
    • Enter your text into the 'Survey Completion Text' box
    • Scroll down and click on the 'save changes' button

ItemGroupDef.Name: Form F3: COVID Impact Survey - Co-Participant
Form F3: COVID Impact Survey - Co-Participant
What kind of care assistance, if any, has become harder to access?
Form F3: COVID Impact Survey - Co-Participant
Form F3: COVID Impact Survey - Co-Participant

Question.TranslatedText: Instructions for the Center This updated COVID-19 survey is an optional form to be filled out by either the participant (if CDR® Dementia Staging Instrument score = 0 or 0.5) or co-participant/caregiver on behalf of the research participant (if CDR® > 0.5); alternatively, it may be administered by study personnel. Participants may decline to answer questions. If Centers want to obtain information on additional issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but any additional material will not be collected for NACC. This form serves as an update to the original COVID-19 impact Survey released in summer 2020, and reflects on several important updates since that time, including vaccinations, repeat infections, evolving understanding of the long-term impacts of COVID-19 particularly on cognitive function, and broader psychosocial stressors which occurred in the same timeline as the initial and subsequent waves of the pandemic. In addition, it is recognized that many of these aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic may have been experienced differently person to person as well as community to community. The survey is intended to capture a summative experience since the onset of the pandemic, may be used either during initial or follow-up visits, and is potentially adaptable to delivery between those times. Attached to this participant form is a supplemental form for co-participants/caregivers of participants with a CDR® > 0.5. This survey is also optional for Centers. Again, if Centers want to obtain information on additional caregiver issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but this additional material will not be collected for NACC. These surveys may be administered by Centers in conjunction with, or unique and separate from, annual in-person or telephone UDS visits. The timing and option to participate in collection of this important data is entirely up to the individual Centers that are part of the NIA ADRC Program. Each Center should consider administering these surveys to as many participants as possible through either mail, telephone, video, and/or in-person contacts. Centers will need to provide information to participants about local vaccination availability for unvaccinated participants that request information. We have tried to capture important scientific information regarding COVID-19 exposure, medical consequences, and impact on social situations; on cognitive, psychiatric, and behavioral issues; and on caregiver burden and related issues. This information may prove to be extremely useful in our understanding of the impact of such a pandemic on the aging population today and the future.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Instructions for the Center

This updated COVID-19 survey is an optional form to be filled out by either the participant (if CDR® Dementia Staging Instrument score = 0 or 0.5) or co-participant/caregiver on behalf of the research participant (if CDR® > 0.5); alternatively, it may be administered by study personnel. Participants may decline to answer questions. If Centers want to obtain information on additional issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but any additional material will not be collected for NACC.

This form serves as an update to the original COVID-19 impact Survey released in summer 2020, and reflects on several important updates since that time, including vaccinations, repeat infections, evolving understanding of the long-term impacts of COVID-19 particularly on cognitive function, and broader psychosocial stressors which occurred in the same timeline as the initial and subsequent waves of the pandemic. In addition, it is recognized that many of these aspects of the COVID-19 pandemic may have been experienced differently person to person as well as community to community. The survey is intended to capture a summative experience since the onset of the pandemic, may be used either during initial or follow-up visits, and is potentially adaptable to delivery between those times.

Attached to this participant form is a supplemental form for co-participants/caregivers of participants with a CDR® > 0.5. This survey is also optional for Centers. Again, if Centers want to obtain information on additional caregiver issues related to COVID-19, they may do so locally, but this additional material will not be collected for NACC.

These surveys may be administered by Centers in conjunction with, or unique and separate from, annual in-person or telephone UDS visits. The timing and option to participate in collection of this important data is entirely up to the individual Centers that are part of the NIA ADRC Program. Each Center should consider administering these surveys to as many participants as possible through either mail, telephone, video, and/or in-person contacts. Centers will need to provide information to participants about local vaccination availability for unvaccinated participants that request information.

We have tried to capture important scientific information regarding COVID-19 exposure, medical consequences, and impact on social situations; on cognitive, psychiatric, and behavioral issues; and on caregiver burden and related issues. This information may prove to be extremely useful in our understanding of the impact of such a pandemic on the aging population today and the future.

Question.TranslatedText: The following COVID-19 survey is an optional form we would like you to fill out (alternatively, the survey may be administered to you by research study staff). We are asking these questions because COVID-19 has presented very new challenges for us all, and we would like to learn about your experience. We also would like to learn how COVID-19 may have affected your well-being and your ability to support the research participant as their co-participant/caregiver. You may decline to answer any of these questions, and it is alright to do so, but please answer as many of the questions as you feel comfortable with. Your research Center may also have additional questions regarding COVID-19.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: The following COVID-19 survey is an optional form we would like you to fill out (alternatively, the survey may be administered to you by research study staff). We are asking these questions because COVID-19 has presented very new challenges for us all, and we would like to learn about your experience. We also would like to learn how COVID-19 may have affected your well-being and your ability to support the research participant as their co-participant/caregiver. You may decline to answer any of these questions, and it is alright to do so, but please answer as many of the questions as you feel comfortable with. Your research Center may also have additional questions regarding COVID-19.

Question.TranslatedText: On a scale of 1-5, how isolated or cut off from family and friends have you felt due to the COVID-19 pandemic?
On a scale of 1-5, how disruptive has the COVID-19 pandemic been to your everyday life?
On a scale of 1-5, since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?
On a scale of 1-6 (with 1 being "I can shake off stress" and 6 being "Stress eats away at me") how would you rate your ability to handle stress?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On a scale of 1-6 (with 1 being "I can shake off stress" and 6 being "Stress eats away at me") how would you rate your ability to handle stress?

Question.TranslatedText: In the past year, on a scale of 1-6 with 1 being "no stress" and 6 being "extreme stress" how would you rate the amount of stress in your life (at home and at work)?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: In the past year, on a scale of 1-6 with 1 being "no stress" and 6 being "extreme stress" how would you rate the amount of stress in your life (at home and at work)?

Question.TranslatedText: Regarding your feelings of connectedness with friends and family during the COVID-19 pandemic, did you feel or have you felt...
Has the COVID-19 pandemic affected your ability to provide care for the research participant?

ItemDef.Name: c19kfam
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader: What kind of care assistance, if any, has become harder to access?

Question.TranslatedText: Ability to find skilled residential facility placement

On a scale of 1-5, how much has the COVID-19 pandemic changed your willingness to allow or encourage your care partner's participation in clinical research if it requires in-person visits to the research clinic?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On a scale of 1-5, how much has the COVID-19 pandemic changed your willingness to allow or encourage your care partner's participation in clinical research if it requires in-person visits to the research clinic?

Question.TranslatedText: On a scale of 1-5, how much has the COVID-19 pandemic changed your own personal willingness to participate in clinical research, irrespective of whether in-person or telephone/remote visits are used?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: On a scale of 1-5, how much has the COVID-19 pandemic changed your own personal willingness to participate in clinical research, irrespective of whether in-person or telephone/remote visits are used?

Question.TranslatedText: Do you have specific care needs that are not addressed above?
Please list any care needs (both yours and the research participant's) that are not being met because of the COVID-19 pandemic:
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Please list any care needs (both yours and the research participant's) that are not being met
because of the COVID-19 pandemic:

Question.TranslatedText: Thank you for taking the time to answer these questions.

Decode.TranslatedText: Mount Sinai School of Medicine ADRC
Oregon Health and Science University, ADRC
About the same level of connection
It is easier to provide care
I am managing the same as always
It is somewhat more difficult to provide care
It is extremely difficult to provide care
